overview: From driving cancer research forward to accurately predicting the weather, Computer Scientists are powering progress. In fact everything from social care to cybersecurity or even space travel, relies on the talents of Computer Science graduates. We would say the sky is the limit, but we're already well beyond that! A degree in Computer Science teaches you to approach technical problems creatively. It also gives you the information and understanding to find ground-breaking solutions to the world's emerging problems. The course will also equip you with the practical skills to approach the specification, design, construction and use of computer systems. In an ever changing technological climate, the Computer Science degree programme is constantly evolving to anticipate emerging digital breakthroughs. You will cover topics like machine learning, augmented reality and data analytics, but also receive a grounding in skills like hardware architecture, software engineering and simulation & modelling too. Employer experience is paramount in this this course, from day one you will learn from prospective employers about 'real world' challenges. Industry placements, company sponsored hackathons and project based learning form a core part of the curriculum and vastly improve our graduate employability rates.
short_overview: Computer Science at Queen's equips you with the skills to approach technical problems creatively and find innovative solutions in areas from healthcare to cybersecurity. You'll learn practical skills in software engineering, data analytics, and machine learning while gaining valuable industry experience through placements with our 500+ partner companies.
course_content: These degrees aim to teach the fundamental principles of Computer Science, together with the necessary skills, tools and techniques to enable our graduates to embark on careers as professional software engineers, or to become suitably qualified to undertake research in Computer Science.
Industrial engagement forms an integral part, balancing academic theory with practical learning.
Students spend a year on a paid, full-time placement with one of 500+ local, national and international employers.
The School has a world class reputation for research and provides excellent facilities, including access to major research centres.
Students have access to world class laboratories equipped with hundreds of PCs and specialized software packages.
Assessment varies by module, including project work, written assignments, and examinations.

year_1.description: Fundamental concepts of computer architecture, hardware organization, and system design principles
Introduction to data management, processing techniques and their applications in computing
Essential mathematical concepts underpinning computer science theory and practice
Core principles of security in computing systems and networks
Introduction to procedural programming concepts and problem-solving techniques
Introduction to object-oriented design principles and implementation
Fundamentals of embedded systems design and programming

year_2.description: Principles and practices of professional software development and project management
Analysis and implementation of efficient algorithms and data organization methods
Design and implementation of relational databases and query languages
Fundamentals of network architecture, protocols and distributed systems

year_3.description: Full-year paid industry placement with one of 500+ partner companies

year_4.description: Independent research and development project addressing a significant computing challenge
Theoretical foundations and practical applications of machine learning algorithms
Contemporary approaches to large-scale software development and system architecture
Design and implementation of multi-threaded applications and parallel computing

entry_requirements.grades: AAB at A-level, or 112 UCAS points
entry_requirements.other_requirements: GCSE Mathematics grade C/4 or higher
entry_requirements.a_level: BBB including at least one preferred A-level (see list below) + GCSE Mathematics grade C/4 OR ABB including at least one relevant A-level (see list below) + GCSE Mathematics grade C/4 A maximum of one BTEC/OCR Single Award or AQA Extended Certificate will be accepted as part of an applicant's portfolio of qualifications with a Distinction* being equated to a grade A at A-level and a Distinction being equated to a grade B at A-level.
entry_requirements.irish_leaving_certificate: H3H3H3H3H4H4/H3H3H3H3H3 including at least one preferred Leaving Certificate subject at grade H3 (see list below) + Ordinary Level grade O4 in Mathematics if not offered at Higher Level OR H3H3H3H3H3H3/H2H3H3H3H3 including at least one relevant Leaving Certificate subject at grade H3 (see list below) + Ordinary Level grade O4 in Mathematics
entry_requirements.international_requirements: For students whose first language is not English, an English language qualification is required, such as an IELTS score of 6.5 with a minimum of 5.5 in each test component.
entry_requirements.preferred_subjects: Computer Science, Computing, Digital Technology, ICT, Mathematics, Further Mathematics, Physics, Technology and Design, or Software Systems Development.

overview: Without software engineering, you wouldn't be reading this page. Software innovation has transformed the way we think about, and interact with, technology. In fact, all the forms of communication, interaction and access that we take for granted today are made possible by software in some shape or form. Which is why the demand for software engineers has never been greater. From improving the efficiency of the apps we use in order to make them more sustainable, to developing scalable and secure app infrastructure, Software Engineers have skills that drive innovation. In essence, they are problem solvers with the ability to take an existing software system and creatively refine, enhance and transform it into something even better. This degree programme is designed to equip you with the analytical, reasoning and practical skills you will need to design, develop and deploy large software systems. Plus, our project based learning approach enables you to craft a degree pathway that fits your own areas of interest. You could find yourself working on anything from apps to virtual and augmented reality; lifesaving smart medical implants to consumer space travel or automated intelligence. Employer experience is embedded into this course and allows students to engage and learn from prospective employers from day one. Through placements, sponsored projects and hackathons, you will engage with employers and begin making a difference to real world problems.
short_overview: Software Engineering teaches you the analytical, reasoning and practical skills to design, develop and deploy large software systems. Our project-based learning approach allows you to work on everything from apps to virtual reality while gaining valuable industry experience through placements with our 500+ employer partners.
course_content: These degrees teach the fundamental principles of Software Engineering, together with the necessary skills, tools and techniques to enable our graduates to embark on careers as professional software engineers.
Special emphasis is placed on individual and team-based software development projects in preparation for industry.
Students spend a year on a paid, full-time placement with one of 500+ local, national and international employers.
The course emphasizes the professional and practical application of software engineering with strong links to local companies.
Project-based learning enables students to craft a degree pathway that fits their own areas of interest.

course_name: Business Information Technology Incl Professional Experience
overview: Much of today's business operates in a dynamic, fast-paced and technologically advanced environment. With the future of business looking set to rely even more heavily on technology. Companies require talented individuals who can bridge the gap between business management and technology, forge new connections and foster continuing innovation in their industries. Studying Business Information Technology at Queen's gives you a sound knowledge of information technology fundamentals and their application in business. Additionally, this course provides a firm foundation in business management. Delivered in partnership with Queen's Management School (QMS) this allows our graduates to address a growing global need for capable and confident leaders in varied business environments. Belfast is uniquely placed to offer opportunities for Business Information Technology graduates. There are more software companies located in Northern Ireland than in any other part of the UK, outside of London. Additionally, Queen's University has links with businesses across the globe, including over 500 local, national and international IT companies. Employer experience is embedded into this course and allows students to engage and learn from prospective employers from day one.
short_overview: Business Information Technology equips you with the knowledge to bridge the gap between business management and technology. This joint program with Queen's Management School gives you a sound foundation in IT fundamentals and their business applications, preparing you for leadership roles in today's technology-driven business environment.
course_content: The Single Honours Business Information Technology degree comprises compulsory modules together with optional modules.
Students spend a year gaining professional experience in industry in a paid full-time post.
The School has excellent links with over 500 local, national and international employers.
Belfast is in the world's top 10 Digital Economies of the Future - the only UK city outside London to be listed.
The course offers a range of learning experiences including team-based projects, lectures, tutorials, and practical sessions.

year_1.description: Introduction to financial and management accounting principles
Database design concepts and implementations for business applications
Understanding behavior in organizational settings
Introduction to programming concepts and problem-solving
Fundamental economic principles and their business applications
Relationships between business operations and wider societal contexts
Core principles and practices of marketing in business

Managing information resources in organizations

Managing business processes and operations efficiently

year_3.description: Full-year paid industry placement with one of 500+ partner companies

Advanced implementation of IT systems in business contexts
Management of product and service supply chains

Managing innovation processes in organizations
Management principles specific to public sector organizations
Formulation and implementation of organizational strategy
Policy frameworks for information management and governance
Analysis of customer decision-making and interactions
Advanced techniques for analyzing and presenting data
Security principles for business networks and systems

entry_requirements.other_requirements: GCSE Mathematics grade C/4 or higher
entry_requirements.a_level: ABB + GCSE Mathematics grade C/4. A maximum of one BTEC/OCR Single Award or AQA Extended Certificate will be accepted as part of an applicant's portfolio of qualifications with a Distinction* being equated to a grade A at A-level and a Distinction being equated to a grade B at A-level.
entry_requirements.irish_leaving_certificate: H3H3H3H3H3H3/H2H3H3H3H3 + if not offered at Higher Level then Ordinary Level grade O4 in Mathematics
entry_requirements.international_requirements: 33 points overall in International Baccalaureate, including 6,5,5 at Higher Level + if not offered at Higher Level/GCSE, then Standard Level grade 4 in Mathematics
entry_requirements.preferred_subjects: Mathematics, Economics, Business Studies, Computing/Computer Science, Physics or Software Systems Development.

course_name: Computing and Information Technology Incl Professional Experience
overview: Technology advances at a rapid pace and businesses must adapt if they are to compete in an ever expanding global economy. A degree in Computer and Information Technology gives you a grounding in a broad range of information technology subjects as well as the skills to manage and administrate complex digital infrastructure. The course develops applied computing, interpersonal, communication and IT skills and readies graduates to develop, select, deliver, manage and maintain cutting-edge IT infrastructures and advanced IT systems. It is ideal for students who are interested in IT and are keen to learn programming, web development, database design and human-computer interaction, it also requires team working skills and nuanced interpersonal interaction. This is further enhanced by a placement year, where you will put into practice the skills you have acquired. In fact, employer experience is embedded into every aspect of Computer and Information Technology at Queen's. This allows students to engage and learn from prospective employers from day one, vastly improving our graduate employability rates.
short_overview: Computing and Information Technology equips you with the skills to manage and administer complex digital infrastructures and IT systems. You'll learn programming, web development, database design, and human-computer interaction while developing teamwork and communication skills, enhanced by a year of professional experience with industry partners.
course_content: This degree aims to teach the necessary skills, tools and techniques to enable our graduates to embark on careers as IT professionals in a wide variety of roles.
The program involves extensive practical work with a significant portion completed in team-orientated projects.
There is an emphasis on user experience and information security throughout the degree.
Students undertake a full year's paid placement to gain practical experience as an IT professional.
The course covers themes including Programming, Computer Architecture, Computer Networks, Database Systems, Human-Computer Interaction, IT Infrastructure, and Web-Based Development.

entry_requirements.other_requirements: GCSE Mathematics grade C/4 or higher
entry_requirements.a_level: BBB including at least one preferred A-level (see list below) + GCSE Mathematics grade C/4 OR ABB including at least one relevant A-level (see list below) + GCSE Mathematics grade C/4 OR AAB + GCSE Mathematics grade C/4. A maximum of one BTEC/OCR Single Award or AQA Extended Certificate will be accepted as part of an applicant's portfolio of qualifications with a Distinction* being equated to a grade A at A-level and a Distinction being equated to a grade B at A-level.
entry_requirements.irish_leaving_certificate: H3H3H3H3H4H4/H3H3H3H3H3 including at least one preferred Leaving Certificate subject at grade H3 (see list below) + Ordinary Level grade O4 in Mathematics if not offered at Higher Level OR H3H3H3H3H3H3/H2H3H3H3H3 including at least one relevant Leaving Certificate subject at grade H3 (see list below) + Ordinary Level grade O4 in Mathematics OR H2H3H3H3H3H3 + Ordinary Level grade O4 in Mathematics

If not offered at Higher Level/GCSE then Standard Level grade 4 in English and Mathematics would be accepted.
entry_requirements.preferred_subjects: Computing, Mathematics or Software Systems Development. Relevant subjects: Biology, Chemistry, Digital Technology, ICT, Physics, Technology and Design or Double Award Applied ICT.

course_name: Data Science with Year of Professional Experience
overview: The aim of the programme is to offer a deep and up-to-date education in data science, machine learning and artificial intelligence that prepares graduates with key knowledge, skills and competencies necessary for employment in data engineering, data analysis, data architect (as well as managerial positions on those topics), or as preparation for further research and innovation careers. In particular the programme aims to provide students with: Comprehensive knowledge and understanding of the fundamental principles of artificial intelligence, data science and machine learning, which will remain applicable through changes in technology. Advanced knowledge and practical skills in the theory and practice of data analytics. The necessary skills, tools and techniques needed to embark on careers as data scientist, or professional developers skilled in data science. Skills in a range of practices, processes, tools and methods applicable to data science in commercial and research contexts. Timely exposure to, and practical experience in, a range of current technologies and emerging trends at the forefront of data science, such as Deep Learning, Natural Language Processing and Trustworthy AI. Opportunities for the development of practical skills in a commercial context.
short_overview: Data Science combines mathematics and computer science to prepare you for careers in data engineering, analysis, and architecture. You'll gain skills in AI, machine learning, and data analytics, with practical experience during a professional placement year working on real-world data projects with industry partners.
course_content: This is a joint degree programme between the School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering and Computer Science and the School of Maths and Physics.
It combines mathematics and computer science for a holistic approach to Data Science and Machine Learning, from theory to practice.
Students will complete a year of professional experience on data analytics with partner companies.
The program provides exposure to current technologies and emerging trends like Deep Learning, Natural Language Processing and Trustworthy AI.
Students develop both theoretical knowledge and practical skills applicable in commercial and research contexts.

year_1.description: Introduction to procedural programming concepts and techniques
Fundamentals of data management and database systems
Core concepts in probability theory and statistical methods
Fundamental mathematical concepts in algebra and analysis
Principles and practice of object-oriented programming

year_2.description: Advanced data organization methods and algorithm design

year_2.description: Foundations of AI and machine learning theory and applications
Vector spaces, matrices, and linear transformations

Theoretical foundations of computer science and algorithms

year_4.description: Capstone project applying data science skills to real-world problems
Advanced techniques for extracting insights from complex datasets
Neural network architectures and applications for complex data
Techniques for analyzing and defending against malicious software
Distributed computing systems and cloud-based data processing
Development of multi-threaded applications for parallel data processing

entry_requirements.other_requirements: GCSE Mathematics grade C/4 or higher
entry_requirements.a_level: AAB/A*BB including Mathematics grade A. A maximum of one BTEC/OCR Single Award or AQA Extended Certificate will be accepted as part of an applicant's portfolio of qualifications with a Distinction* being equated to a grade A at A-level and a Distinction being equated to a grade B at A-level.
entry_requirements.irish_leaving_certificate: H2H3H3H3H3H3 including Higher Level grade H2 in Mathematics. If not offered at Higher Level then Ordinary Level grade O4 in English.
entry_requirements.international_requirements: 34 points overall including 6,6,5 at Higher Level with Higher Level grade 6 in Mathematics. Standard Level grade 4 in English Language would be accepted.
entry_requirements.preferred_subjects: Mathematics, Further Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics or Physics.

overview: Computer Engineering is a dynamic and collaborative degree programme; combining academic thought with practical application. Computer Engineers make the impossible possible. They challenge conventional processes and look beyond what exists towards what comes next. From everyday systems, like games consoles and mobile phones to advanced systems for surveillance and medical devices, the modern world is made possible by the devices you will be taught to understand and develop during the Computer Engineering undergraduate programme. Additionally, Computer Engineering is one of the few research-led degrees in Queen's which includes the design of both electronic hardware and software. As a Computer Engineering graduate you can not only design the physical hardware but also write the software to run it. Through our diverse network of industry links you begin learning from prospective employers from day one. Industry placements, company-sponsored hackathons and project challenges are a core part of the curriculum and vastly improve our graduate employability rates.
short_overview: Computer Engineering combines hardware and software design, preparing you to create the technologies that power our modern world. From game consoles and mobile phones to surveillance systems and medical devices, you'll learn to develop innovative solutions while building valuable industry connections through placements and projects.
course_content: This degree requires three years of full-time study with an optional year in industry.
The program combines both electronic hardware design and software development.
Students work on projects with direct industry involvement through placements, hackathons, and challenges.
The curriculum covers embedded systems, digital electronics, programming, signals and communications.
Graduates are highly sought-after for roles in software, electronics, or combined positions across various industries.

year_1.description: Introduction to embedded system design and programming
Fundamentals of signal processing and communication systems
Principles and practice of object-oriented programming
Mathematical concepts essential for computer engineering
Fundamentals of digital logic and system design
Basic principles of electric circuit analysis and design

year_2.description: Advanced mathematical methods for computer engineering

Advanced embedded system design and implementation

entry_requirements.a_level: ABB including Mathematics and at least one from Computer Science, Computing, Digital Technology, Electronics, Further Mathematics, Geography, ICT, Physics, Technology and Design or Double Award Applied ICT. GCSE Mathematics grade C/4 required if not offered at A-level.

entry_requirements.preferred_subjects: Mathematics, Physics, Electronics, Computer Science, Computing, or Technology and Design.
